page.title: 18RELIGION - 2
page.content: The Roman Catholic Churches of St. Chad, Witton Park and St. Paulinus, West Auckland share the area and the parishoners are widely scattered. The parish primary School of St. Chad's has the family atmosphere of a small village community. The Churches are active and have a busy calendar with annual Garden Fetes. Attendance at Sunday Mass is regularly about 261. There were eight Methodist Churches in the area for Miners, and Etherley Church for Railwaymen. Mine closures have resulted in the closing of five of the Churches. Toft Hill has 26 members, Witton park 17, Etherley 43, and Phoenix Row 7, Making Methodist the most popular Church in the area. Nick Beddon, the Vicar of the Saxon CHurch, which attracts 10 000 visitors a year, says 'The whole world comes to Escomb, but the locals don't see it.'
